post.body: Maybe.... not getting the error but seem to be unable to delete the old posts from the other profile. Let me try cycling ZeroNet
Just another test as I muck about in the code for ZeroMe

Another rainy day. Just setup my website, Reke-apedia, a wiki style site I will be using to document anything I do on ZeroNet. 

[Reke-apedia](http://127.0.0.1:43110/149xu6hWJgu7V9rjf93MNUjFKi6r1mjKAA/)

I *think* I have it configured correctly but short of messing with my identity files I'm not sure. It should be locked to my id. So if you are interested please feel free to go in and test the permissions for me by seeing if you can edit a page or create a new one.

How many versions of ZeroMe do we need? It seems like every developer has their own version, on top of a dozen clones / mods just bouncing around. 

Not a serious criticism, more just exasperated at how frequently I connect to a site for it to pop up with the ZeroMe logo.

Anyone know a good place to buy NMC in the US? I've been hunting for a good exchange that doesn't require a wire transfer or a Russian bank account, and I've been coming up short since I only want to convert a few dollars.

So ya for the new version of ZeroNet. It has actually run for 24 hour without crashing. Kudos for stability. I was only using 0.5.6 for a few days but dang if I could keep it running for more than a few hours without the server hanging.
Anyone accidentally type NetZero instead of ZeroNet?
Thanks to 0list I was able to get my hand on some NMC and I registered my bit domain. Ya!
Well I'm running off for a few days.

comment.body: @008: Thanks for the link. I submitted.
@Styromaniac: Ya I'm seeding that one too. Not that I really think in its current form ZeroNet is really usable on mobile.
@Kaffie: Like I said not a serious criticism.

I do like the fact that if there is something I don't like about the ZeroMe interface I can clone and create a new one, but at the same time I don't like that it creates a whole new site that gets seeded and distributed just for my own customization. And yes the cloning things is awesome, I'm looking to use ZeroWiki as the basis of a few planned sites.

@Kaffie: Well I use the term ZeroWiki loosely. I'm mostly just cherry picking a few things I like design wise, but the big one will be a merger site. I hope to be running a hopefully full and well managed torrent database.

I've seen a few torrent pools here in ZeroNet but nothing as organized and complete as a clearnet torrent site. My hope is that by only allowing verified and trusted torrents into the database will gather it a following while cutting down on the size.

@Kaffie: Awe sorry. Maybe. I have a lot of prototyping ahead of me. At this point its just a bunch of ideas. I think my inspiration for a torrent site comes from the WebTorrent.js library and wanting to see if I can't replicate a clearnet torrent index in ZeroNet.

@Kaffie: Well I'm not looking to use WebTorrent to stream the files, just access the torrent swarm to display current swarm conditions. But who knows. I'll defiantly look at those. I didn't know about the limitation and who knows at this point I'm going to probably focus on a merger site prototype.

@狗蛋: Ya looked at BTC-e but getting money into my account from there is the problem. They only accept deposits from Russian/Euro Banks, and while two of them accept US bank cards, they want verified personal information to create an account, and researching them has not led me to be confident enough to do that.

I get the second issue all the time, especially ZeroMe. For me I think it has to do with the ZeroNet waiting for the internal SQL server. Depending on how many hubs you have merged, the ZeroMe database can be quite large.
@Musickiller: Yup. Though the most important thing I got was a purchase chain that will allow me to turn USD into NMC without exposing my bank account.
@Musickiller: Specifically the person who runs it. Not sure their profile but I found their BitMessage address and chatted.
